speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
Who
               
              were
               
              those
               
              went
               
              by
              ?

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
Queen
               
              Hecuba
               
              and
               
              Helen
              .

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
And
               
              whither
               
              go
               
              they
              ?

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
Up
               
              to
               
              the
               
              eastern
               
              tower
              ,

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
Whose
               
              height
               
              commands
               
              as
               
              subject
               
              all
               
              the
               
              vale
              ,

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
To
               
              see
               
              the
               
              battle
              .
               
              Hector
              ,
               
              whose
               
              patience

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
Is
               
              as
               
              a
               
              virtue
               
              fixed
              ,
               
              today
               
              was
               
              moved
              .

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
He
               
              chid
               
              Andromache
               
              and
               
              struck
               
              his
               
              armorer
              ;

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
And
              ,
               
              like
               
              as
               
              there
               
              were
               
              husbandry
               
              in
               
              war
              ,

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
Before
               
              the
               
              sun
               
              rose
               
              he
               
              was
               
              harnessed
               
              light
              ,

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
And
               
              to
               
              the
               
              field
               
              goes
               
              he
              ,
               
              where
               
              every
               
              flower

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
Did
               
              as
               
              a
               
              prophet
               
              weep
               
              what
               
              it
               
              foresaw

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
In
               
              Hector’s
               
              wrath
              .

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
What
               
              was
               
              his
               
              cause
               
              of
               
              anger
              ?

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
The
               
              noise
               
              goes
              ,
               
              this
              :
               
              there
               
              is
               
              among
               
              the
               
              Greeks

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
A
               
              lord
               
              of
               
              Trojan
               
              blood
              ,
               
              nephew
               
              to
               
              Hector
              .

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
They
               
              call
               
              him
               
              Ajax
              .

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
Good
              ;
               
              and
               
              what
               
              of
               
              him
              ?

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
They
               
              say
               
              he
               
              is
               
              a
               
              very
               
              man
               
              per
               
              se

speaker: ALEXANDER
text:
And
               
              stands
               
              alone
              .

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: So do all men unless they are drunk, sick,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: or have no legs.

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: This man, lady, hath robbed many beasts

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: of their particular additions. He is as valiant as the

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: lion, churlish as the bear, slow as the elephant, a

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: man into whom nature hath so crowded humors

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: that his valor is crushed into folly, his folly sauced

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: with discretion. There is no man hath a virtue that

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: he hath not a glimpse of, nor any man an attaint

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: but he carries some stain of it. He is melancholy

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: without cause and merry against the hair. He hath

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: the joints of everything, but everything so out of

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: joint that he is a gouty Briareus, many hands and

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: no use, or purblind Argus, all eyes and no sight.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: But how should this man that makes me

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: smile make Hector angry?

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: They say he yesterday coped Hector in the

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: battle and struck him down, the disdain and

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: shame whereof hath ever since kept Hector fasting

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: and waking.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Who comes here?

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: Madam, your Uncle Pandarus.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Hector’s a gallant man.

speaker: ALEXANDER
text: As may be in the world, lady.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: What’s that? What’s that?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Good morrow, Uncle Pandarus.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Good morrow, Cousin Cressid. What do you

speaker: PANDARUS
text: talk of?— Good morrow, Alexander.—How do you,

speaker: PANDARUS
text: cousin? When were you at Ilium?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: This morning, uncle.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: What were you talking of when I came?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Was Hector armed and gone ere you came to

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Ilium? Helen was not up, was she?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Hector was gone, but Helen was not up.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: E’en so. Hector was stirring early.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: That were we talking of, and of his anger.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Was he angry?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: So he says here.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: True, he was so. I know the cause too. He’ll

speaker: PANDARUS
text: lay about him today, I can tell them that; and

speaker: PANDARUS
text: there’s Troilus will not come far behind him. Let

speaker: PANDARUS
text: them take heed of Troilus, I can tell them that too.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: What, is he angry too?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Who, Troilus? Troilus is the better man of

speaker: PANDARUS
text: the two.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: O Jupiter, there’s no comparison.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: What, not between Troilus and Hector? Do

speaker: PANDARUS
text: you know a man if you see him?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Ay, if I ever saw him before and knew him.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Well, I say Troilus is Troilus.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Then you say as I say, for I am sure he is not

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Hector.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: No, nor Hector is not Troilus in some degrees.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: ’Tis just to each of them; he is himself.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Himself? Alas, poor Troilus, I would he were.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: So he is.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Condition I had gone barefoot to India.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: He is not Hector.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Himself? No, he’s not himself. Would he

speaker: PANDARUS
text: were himself! Well, the gods are above. Time must

speaker: PANDARUS
text: friend or end. Well, Troilus, well, I would my heart

speaker: PANDARUS
text: were in her body. No, Hector is not a better man

speaker: PANDARUS
text: than Troilus.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Excuse me.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: He is elder.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Pardon me, pardon me.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Th’ other's not come to ’t. You shall tell me

speaker: PANDARUS
text: another tale when th’ other’s come to ’t. Hector

speaker: PANDARUS
text: shall not have his wit this year.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: He shall not need it, if he have his own.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Nor his qualities.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: No matter.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Nor his beauty.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: ’Twould not become him. His own ’s better.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: You have no judgment, niece. Helen herself

speaker: PANDARUS
text: swore th’ other day that Troilus, for a brown favor—

speaker: PANDARUS
text: for so ’tis, I must confess—not brown neither—

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: No, but brown.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Faith, to say truth, brown and not brown.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: To say the truth, true and not true.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: She praised his complexion above Paris’.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Why, Paris hath color enough.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: So he has.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Then Troilus should have too much. If she

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: praised him above, his complexion is higher than

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: his. He having color enough, and the other higher,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: is too flaming a praise for a good complexion. I

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: had as lief Helen’s golden tongue had commended

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Troilus for a copper nose.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: I swear to you, I think Helen loves him better

speaker: PANDARUS
text: than Paris.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Then she’s a merry Greek indeed.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Nay, I am sure she does. She came to him

speaker: PANDARUS
text: th’ other day into the compassed window—and

speaker: PANDARUS
text: you know he has not past three or four hairs on his

speaker: PANDARUS
text: chin—

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Indeed, a tapster’s arithmetic may soon bring

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: his particulars therein to a total.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Why, he is very young, and yet will he within

speaker: PANDARUS
text: three pound lift as much as his brother Hector.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Is he so young a man and so old a lifter?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: But to prove to you that Helen loves him: she

speaker: PANDARUS
text: came and puts me her white hand to his cloven

speaker: PANDARUS
text: chin—

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Juno have mercy! How came it cloven?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Why, you know ’tis dimpled. I think his

speaker: PANDARUS
text: smiling becomes him better than any man in all

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Phrygia.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: O, he smiles valiantly.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Does he not?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: O yes, an ’twere a cloud in autumn.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Why, go to, then. But to prove to you that

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Helen loves Troilus—

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Troilus will stand to the proof if you’ll

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: prove it so.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Troilus? Why, he esteems her no more than

speaker: PANDARUS
text: I esteem an addle egg.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: If you love an addle egg as well as you love

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: an idle head, you would eat chickens i’ th’ shell.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: I cannot choose but laugh to think how she

speaker: PANDARUS
text: tickled his chin. Indeed, she has a marvellous

speaker: PANDARUS
text: white hand, I must needs confess—

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Without the rack.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: And she takes upon her to spy a white hair

speaker: PANDARUS
text: on his chin.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Alas, poor chin! Many a wart is richer.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: But there was such laughing! Queen Hecuba

speaker: PANDARUS
text: laughed that her eyes ran o’er—

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: With millstones.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: And Cassandra laughed—

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: But there was a more temperate fire under

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: the pot of her eyes. Did her eyes run o’er too?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: And Hector laughed.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: At what was all this laughing?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Marry, at the white hair that Helen spied on

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Troilus’ chin.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: An ’t had been a green hair, I should have

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: laughed too.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: They laughed not so much at the hair as at

speaker: PANDARUS
text: his pretty answer.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: What was his answer?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Quoth she “Here’s but two-and-fifty hairs

speaker: PANDARUS
text: on your chin, and one of them is white.”

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: This is her question.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: That’s true, make no question of that. “Two-and-fifty

speaker: PANDARUS
text: hairs,” quoth he, “and one white. That

speaker: PANDARUS
text: white hair is my father, and all the rest are his

speaker: PANDARUS
text: sons.” “Jupiter!” quoth she, “which of these hairs

speaker: PANDARUS
text: is Paris, my husband?” “The forked one,” quoth he.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: “Pluck ’t out, and give it him.” But there was such

speaker: PANDARUS
text: laughing, and Helen so blushed, and Paris so

speaker: PANDARUS
text: chafed, and all the rest so laughed that it passed.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: So let it now, for it has been a great while

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: going by.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Well, cousin, I told you a thing yesterday.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Think on ’t.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: So I do.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: I’ll be sworn ’tis true. He will weep you an

speaker: PANDARUS
text: ’twere a man born in April.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: And I’ll spring up in his tears an ’twere a nettle

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: against May.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Hark, they are coming from the field. Shall

speaker: PANDARUS
text: we stand up here and see them as they pass toward

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Ilium? Good niece, do, sweet niece Cressida.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: At your pleasure.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Here, here, here’s an excellent place. Here

speaker: PANDARUS
text: we may see most bravely. I’ll tell you them all by

speaker: PANDARUS
text: their names as they pass by, but mark Troilus

speaker: PANDARUS
text: above the rest.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Speak not so loud.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: That’s Aeneas. Is not that a brave man? He’s

speaker: PANDARUS
text: one of the flowers of Troy, I can tell you. But mark

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Troilus; you shall see anon.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Who’s that?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: That’s Antenor. He has a shrewd wit, I can

speaker: PANDARUS
text: tell you, and he’s a man good enough. He’s one o’

speaker: PANDARUS
text: th’ soundest judgments in Troy whosoever; and a

speaker: PANDARUS
text: proper man of person. When comes Troilus? I’ll

speaker: PANDARUS
text: show you Troilus anon. If he see me, you shall see

speaker: PANDARUS
text: him nod at me.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Will he give you the nod?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: You shall see.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: If he do, the rich shall have more.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: That’s Hector, that, that, look you, that.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: There’s a fellow!—Go thy way, Hector!—There’s a

speaker: PANDARUS
text: brave man, niece. O brave Hector! Look how he

speaker: PANDARUS
text: looks. There’s a countenance! Is ’t not a brave man?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: O, a brave man!

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Is he not? It does a man’s heart good. Look

speaker: PANDARUS
text: you what hacks are on his helmet. Look you yonder,

speaker: PANDARUS
text: do you see? Look you there. There’s no jesting;

speaker: PANDARUS
text: there’s laying on, take ’t off who will, as they say.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: There be hacks.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Be those with swords?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Swords, anything, he cares not. An the devil

speaker: PANDARUS
text: come to him, it’s all one. By God’s lid, it does one’s

speaker: PANDARUS
text: heart good.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Yonder comes Paris, yonder comes Paris! Look you

speaker: PANDARUS
text: yonder, niece. Is ’t not a gallant man too? Is ’t not?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Why, this is brave now. Who said he came hurt

speaker: PANDARUS
text: home today? He’s not hurt. Why, this will do

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Helen’s heart good now, ha? Would I could see

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Troilus now! You shall see Troilus anon.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Who’s that?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: That’s Helenus. I marvel where Troilus is.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: That’s Helenus. I think he went not forth today.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: That’s Helenus.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Can Helenus fight, uncle?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Helenus? No. Yes, he’ll fight indifferent

speaker: PANDARUS
text: well. I marvel where Troilus is. Hark, do you not

speaker: PANDARUS
text: hear the people cry “Troilus”? Helenus is a priest.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: What sneaking fellow comes yonder?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Where? Yonder? That’s Deiphobus. ’Tis

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Troilus! There’s a man, niece. Hem! Brave Troilus,

speaker: PANDARUS
text: the prince of chivalry!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Peace, for shame, peace.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Mark him. Note him. O brave Troilus! Look

speaker: PANDARUS
text: well upon him, niece. Look you how his sword is

speaker: PANDARUS
text: bloodied and his helm more hacked than Hector’s,

speaker: PANDARUS
text: and how he looks, and how he goes. O admirable

speaker: PANDARUS
text: youth! He never saw three and twenty.—Go thy

speaker: PANDARUS
text: way, Troilus; go thy way!—Had I a sister were a

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Grace, or a daughter a goddess, he should take his

speaker: PANDARUS
text: choice. O admirable man! Paris? Paris is dirt to

speaker: PANDARUS
text: him; and I warrant Helen, to change, would give

speaker: PANDARUS
text: an eye to boot.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Here comes more.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Asses, fools, dolts, chaff and bran, chaff and

speaker: PANDARUS
text: bran, porridge after meat. I could live and die in

speaker: PANDARUS
text: the eyes of Troilus. Ne’er look, ne’er look; the

speaker: PANDARUS
text: eagles are gone. Crows and daws, crows and daws!

speaker: PANDARUS
text: I had rather be such a man as Troilus than

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Agamemnon and all Greece.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: There is amongst the Greeks Achilles, a better

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: man than Troilus.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Achilles? A drayman, a porter, a very camel!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Well, well.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: “Well, well”? Why, have you any discretion?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Have you any eyes? Do you know what a man is? Is

speaker: PANDARUS
text: not birth, beauty, good shape, discourse, manhood,

speaker: PANDARUS
text: learning, gentleness, virtue, youth, liberality and

speaker: PANDARUS
text: such-like the spice and salt that season a man?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Ay, a minced man; and then to be baked with

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: no date in the pie, for then the man’s date is out.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: You are such a woman a man knows not at

speaker: PANDARUS
text: what ward you lie.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Upon my back to defend my belly, upon my

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: wit to defend my wiles, upon my secrecy to defend

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: mine honesty, my mask to defend my beauty, and

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: you to defend all these; and at all these wards I lie,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: at a thousand watches.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Say one of your watches.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Nay, I’ll watch you for that, and that’s one of

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: the chiefest of them too. If I cannot ward what I

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: would not have hit, I can watch you for telling how

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: I took the blow—unless it swell past hiding, and

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: then it’s past watching.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: You are such another!

speaker: BOY
text: Sir, my lord would instantly speak with you.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Where?

speaker: BOY
text: At your own house. There he unarms him.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Good boy, tell him I come.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: I doubt he be hurt.—Fare you well, good niece.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: Adieu, uncle.

speaker: PANDARUS
text: I will be with you, niece, by and by.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text: To bring, uncle?

speaker: PANDARUS
text: Ay, a token from Troilus.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
By
               
              the
               
              same
               
              token
              ,
               
              you
               
              are
               
              a
               
              bawd
              .

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
Words
              ,
               
              vows
              ,
               
              gifts
              ,
               
              tears
              ,
               
              and
               
              love’s
               
              full
               
              sacrifice

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
He
               
              offers
               
              in
               
              another’s
               
              enterprise
              ;

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
But
               
              more
               
              in
               
              Troilus
               
              thousandfold
               
              I
               
              see

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
Than
               
              in
               
              the
               
              glass
               
              of
               
              Pandar’s
               
              praise
               
              may
               
              be
              .

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
Yet
               
              hold
               
              I
               
              off
              .
               
              Women
               
              are
               
              angels
              ,
               
              wooing
              ;

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
Things
               
              won
               
              are
               
              done
              ;
               
              joy’s
               
              soul
               
              lies
               
              in
               
              the
               
              doing
              .

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
That
               
              she
               
              beloved
               
              knows
               
              naught
               
              that
               
              knows
               
              not
               
              this
              :

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
Men
               
              prize
               
              the
               
              thing
               
              ungained
               
              more
               
              than
               
              it
               
              is
              .

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
That
               
              she
               
              was
               
              never
               
              yet
               
              that
               
              ever
               
              knew

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
Love
               
              got
               
              so
               
              sweet
               
              as
               
              when
               
              desire
               
              did
               
              sue
              .

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
Therefore
               
              this
               
              maxim
               
              out
               
              of
               
              love
               
              I
               
              teach
              :

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
Achievement
               
              is
               
              command
              ;
               
              ungained
              ,
               
              beseech
              .

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
Then
               
              though
               
              my
               
              heart’s
               
              content
               
              firm
               
              love
               
              doth
               
              bear
              ,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text:
Nothing
               
              of
               
              that
               
              shall
               
              from
               
              mine
               
              eyes
               
              appear
              .
